text: This was a pretty solid RPG: straight to the point, battle system was deep while being simple, dungeon navigation was a blast (with that slow-mo thing to get coins), not a million characters to use (something I always hated). I should replay this someday, even if it's just for the hidden boss that you have to play through a 2nd loop.

The remake of WA1, Alter Code F I have yet to play, I have not played WA Mobile spin-off game and XF/Crossfire is a spin-off strategy game Iï»¿ have also yet to play.

author: LMWYBC1996

text: I hadn't listened to this game's soundtrack in a while, I actually had forgotten how much I liked it. It has one of my favorite town themes (VGM 38) and post-final boss themes (VGM 191). I even really liked the game and its story, which I know a lot of people didn't. I especially thought the sadder moments were memorable. *Spoilers* During the ending, when you learn that Raquel (in the pic) actually succumbed to her disease before finding a cure, I thought that was a pretty bold move by MV.
author: SupraDarky
